chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (X : Set) (x y : X), si X true x y = x

Premises:
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.N {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.I {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
si : forall X : Set, bool -> X -> X -> X
PeanoNat.Nat.eqb_spec : forall x y : nat, Bool.reflect (x = y) (PeanoNat.Nat.eqb x y)
BinNat.N.eqb_spec : forall x y : BinNums.N, Bool.reflect (x = y) (BinNat.N.eqb x y)
BinPos.Pos.eqb_spec : forall x y : BinNums.positive, Bool.reflect (x = y) (BinPos.Pos.eqb x y)
BinInt.Z.eqb_spec : forall x y : BinNums.Z, Bool.reflect (x = y) (BinInt.Z.eqb x y)
Byte.byte_dec_lb : forall x y : Byte.byte, x = y -> Byte.eqb x y = true
Zbool.Zeq_is_eq_bool : forall x y : BinNums.Z, x = y < -> Zbool.Zeq_bool x y = true
Byte.byte_dec_bl : forall x y : Byte.byte, Byte.eqb x y = true -> x = y
Zbool.Zle_bool_total : forall x y : BinNums.Z, {BinInt.Z.leb x y = true} + {BinInt.Z.leb y x = true}
BinInt.Z.leb_gt : forall x y : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.leb x y = false < -> BinInt.Z.lt y x
Byte.eqb_false : forall x y : Byte.byte, Byte.eqb x y = false -> x <> y
Fin.FS_inj : forall x y : Fin.t ?n, Fin.FS x = Fin.FS y -> x = y where ?n : [ |- nat]

VectorEq.eqb_eq : forall (A : Type) (A_beq : A -> A -> bool), (forall x y : A, A_beq x y = true <-> x = y) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 v2 : VectorDef.t A n), VectorEq.eqb A A_beq v1 v2 = true < -> v1 = v2
VectorEq.eq_dec : forall (A : Type) (A_beq : A -> A -> bool), (forall x y : A, A_beq x y = true <-> x = y) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 v2 : VectorDef.t A n), {v1 = v2} + {v1 <> v2}
Tauto.eval_cnf_app : forall (Env Term' Annot : Type) (eval' : Env -> Term' -> Prop) (env : Env) (x y : list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot)), Tauto.eval_cnf eval' env (List.rev_append x y) < -> Tauto.eval_cnf eval' env x /\ Tauto.eval_cnf eval' env y
Setoid.Seq_sym : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y x

Eqdep_dec.UIP_refl_bool : forall (b : bool) (x : b = b), x = eq_refl
List.find_some : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A) (x : A), List.find f l = Some x -> List.In x l /\ f x = true
Byte.byte_eq_dec : forall x y : Byte.byte, {x = y} + {x <> y}
List.filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : list A), List.In x (List.filter f l) < -> List.In x l /\ f x = true

Ring_theory.IDmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> forall reqb : R -> R -> bool, (forall x y : R, reqb x y = true -> req x y) -> Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp reqb (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=R))
BinIntDef.Z.leb = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match BinIntDef.Z.compare x y with | Gt => false | _ => true end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments BinIntDef.Z.leb (_ _)%Z_scope
Zbool.Zeq_bool = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match BinInt.Z.compare x y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments Zbool.Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
Ring_theory.mkRmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul : C -> C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), req (phi cO) rO -> req (phi cI) rI -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y))) -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y))) -> (forall x y : C, ceqb x y = true -> req (phi x) (phi y)) -> Ring_theory.semi_morph rO rI radd rmul req cO cI cadd cmul ceqb phi

Record semi_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul : C -> C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkRmorph { Smorph0 : req (phi cO) rO; Smorph1 : req (phi cI) rI; Smorph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); Smorph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); Smorph_eq : forall x y : C, ceqb x y = true -> req (phi x) (phi y) } Arguments Ring_theory.semi_morph [R]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _)%function_scope [C]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Ring_theory...
